Lesson Narrative

In a previous lesson, students solved systems of linear equations by graphing. Here, they transition to solving systems algebraically—by substitution—and to reasoning about systems without context.

The lesson activates and builds on what students have learned in grade 8 about solving by substitution. Students see that a system can be solved by replacing a variable with a number or with an expression and that various substitutions can be done to solve the same system. They also begin to build an awareness of the kinds of systems that are conducive to being solved by substitution.

Students practice looking for and making use of structure as they identify the variables or expressions to substitute and ways to perform substitutions efficiently.

Learning Goals (Teacher Facing)

Students will be able to:

  • Recognize that a system can be efficiently solved by substitution if one variable is already isolated or can easily be isolated.
  • Recognize that there are multiple ways to perform substitution to solve a system of equations.
  • Solve systems of linear equations by substituting a variable with a number or an expression and check solutions by substituting them back into the equations.

Learning Targets (Student Facing)

  • Solve systems of equations by substituting a variable or an expression.
  • Identify more than one way to perform substitution and decide how to substitute based on how the given equations are written.

Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills (TEKS)

TEKS

Explanation of Coverage

A.5(C) solve systems of two linear equations with two variables for mathematical and real-world problems.

Full coverage: Lesson provides content that covers all parts of this TEKS.


Lesson Activities

Here are the instructional activities for the lesson:

  • 2.2.1: Finding Connections between Graphs and Equations
  • 2.2.2: Checking Solutions in Systems
    • 2.2.2: Self Check
    • 2.2.2: Additional Resources
  • 2.2.3: Solving Equations Using Substitution
    • 2.2.3: Self Check
    • 2.2.3: Additional Resources
  • 2.2.4: Solving More Equations
Students will also complete a series of problems in the 2.2.5: Practice.

Required Materials

  • Graphing technology

Required Preparation

Access to graphing technology available for students.

Lesson Vocabulary

During this lesson, it is important to:

  • Familiarize students with the vocabulary words they will see throughout the lesson. Encourage students to look for these words and notice their use and meanings.
  • Encourage students to use key vocabulary words in “math talk” and their written and oral explanations.
  • Utilize a word wall. Sample cards are located here: Mathematics Vocabulary Word Wall Cards

 Vocabulary words that are emphasized in this lesson include:

 Previous Vocabulary:

  • system of equations
  • solutions to a system of equations

 New Vocabulary:

  • substitution
